description: From Middle French monomachie, or its source, Latin monomachia. Also mono- +‎ -machy.

entries.meaning: (now rare) A fight or other contest between two people or forces; a duel; single combat. [from 16th c.]
examples: Wherefore we most heartily provoke, challenge, and defy your Lordship to the said combat and monomachy  […]
